critique:
The document is a formal announcement of the death of Vice-President Henry Wilson and instructions for honoring him. As the President, the primary emotion I want to elicit is sadness and respect for the deceased. There is also an element of solemnity and perhaps a touch of surprise at the suddenness of the death. There is no intention to elicit joy, anger, fear, or disgust. The initial scores reflect this assessment.

Revised scores:
- Joy: 1 (no joy intended)
- Sadness: 8 (profound sorrow is expressed)
- Anger: 1 (no anger intended)
- Fear: 1 (no fear intended)
- Disgust: 1 (no disgust intended)
- Surprise: 3 (sudden death may cause surprise)
